alert.note: Alert for Butler; Chase; Chautauqua; Cowley; Elk; Greenwood; Sedgwick; Sumner (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 12:55AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Elk, Cowley, southeastern Sedgwick, southeastern Chase, Butler, northern Sumner, western Chautauqua and Greenwood Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 1255 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles east of Burns to 5 miles south of Clearwater. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wichita, Derby, El Dorado, Winfield, Andover, Haysville, Augusta, Wellington, Bel Aire, Mulvane, Rose Hill, Eureka, Clearwater, Douglass, Belle Plaine, Towanda, Conway Springs, Oxford, Benton and Udall. This includes the following highways... Interstate 135 between Mile Markers 0 and 9. Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 19 and 113. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Butler; Chase; Chautauqua; Cowley; Elk; Greenwood; Sedgwick; Sumner
